Articles.Content:
Um, so there are supposed to be new temperature gauges you can turn on and off with F10. I don't see them. What am I missing?

Also, in the VAB in the parts list how come I can't see the drag value of parts anymore. Did that go away at some point??

Thanks
The gauges only show up on screen when a parts temperature reach a certain point (70% of maxTemp I think). No clue about the drag values though.
the temperature gauges only appear once the parts are close to exploding (around 70%). Not sure about the drag values.

In flight (landed too)

F10 - temperature warning. on by default.

F11 - heat overlay

F12 - aero overlay + Steam screenshot

you can toggle each on/off as you please.

I think drag values are not displayed anymore because the new aerodynamic model doesn't add up the drag of all the parts of the rocket to get the total drag (as in pre 1.0); but instead calculates the general drag in a new way considering what parts are actually exposed to airflow (think about fairings).

Also drag now depends on the orientation of the part.

Then the real effect of a part on your ship could not be predicted by just a number.

> 
> F12 - aero overlay + Steam screenshot

Yeah, that ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Yeah, I wish you could turn the temperature gauges off. I'd rather just see temp on the right click menu to be honest. Any gui element that sits on top of the craft is kind of annoying and distracting.
